Sentencas: The operation of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) based on BaCe0.8Y0.2O3-alpha (BCY20) at 800 degrees C was studied without using an anode material.
Titulo: Chemical and redox stabilities of a solid oxide fuel cell with BaCe0.8Y0.2O3-α functioning as an electrolyte and as an anode

Sentencas: A porous, Ce-rich phase with a fluorite structure was formed at a depth of approximately 10 mu m from the BCY20 surface by heat treatment at 1700 degrees C.
Titulo: Chemical and redox stabilities of a solid oxide fuel cell with BaCe0.8Y0.2O3-α functioning as an electrolyte and as an anode

Sentencas: This was due to the vaporization of BaO from the BCY20 surface.
Titulo: Chemical and redox stabilities of a solid oxide fuel cell with BaCe0.8Y0.2O3-α functioning as an electrolyte and as an anode

Sentencas: This treatment improved the cell performance and chemical stability to CO2 because the Ce-rich phase functioned as an electrically conducting and protective layer.
Titulo: Chemical and redox stabilities of a solid oxide fuel cell with BaCe0.8Y0.2O3-α functioning as an electrolyte and as an anode

Sentencas: The heat-treated BCY20 also had better chemical and redox stabilities over a Ni-Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 (SDC) cermet anode attached to the SDC electrolyte.
Titulo: Chemical and redox stabilities of a solid oxide fuel cell with BaCe0.8Y0.2O3-α functioning as an electrolyte and as an anode

Sentencas: The cell with the heat-treated BCY20 operated well on unhumidified methane, ethane, propane, and butane without carbon deposition, while the cell with the Ni-SDC cermet anode degraded within a few hours.
Titulo: Chemical and redox stabilities of a solid oxide fuel cell with BaCe0.8Y0.2O3-α functioning as an electrolyte and as an anode

Sentencas: Moreover, the BCY20 showed higher tolerance to 10 ppm H2S and stability over 20 times redox cycling in comparison to the Ni-SDC cermet anode.
Titulo: Chemical and redox stabilities of a solid oxide fuel cell with BaCe0.8Y0.2O3-α functioning as an electrolyte and as an anode
